snippet: Analysts say the 14th straight day of patrols in the East China Sea suggests China is trying to wear down Japan’s resolve.
abstract: Chinese patrol ships enter waters around disputed islands in East China Sea for 14th straight day, in what analysts call sign that China has embarked on what appears to be new, long-term strategy for challenging Japan’s control of the islands.

byline.contributor: Jane Perlez contributed reporting from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: Analysts say the 14th straight day of patrols in the East China Sea suggests China is trying to wear down Japan’s resolve.

headline.seo: China Keeps Up Pressure on Japan Over Disputed Islands With Patrols
headline.main: Chinese Patrol Ships Pressuring Japan Over Islands
headline.print_headline: Chinese Patrol Ships Pressuring Japan Over Islands
